definition: Dickens (name)/Charles Dickens (1812-1870), great English novelist
low ranking public official (old)
surname Di/generic name for northern ethnic minorities during the Qin and Han Dynasties (221 BC-220 AD)
more/even more/further/still/still more
to change or replace/to experience/one of the five two-hour periods into which the night was formerly divided/watch (e.g. of a sentry or guard)
(phonetic)/this
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
Charles Dickens (1812-1870), great English novelist
pinyin: Cha2 er3 si1 · Di2 geng1 si1

sentences.english: Dickens was contemporary with Gong Zizheng.
sentences.chinese: 狄更斯和龔自珍同時代。

sentences.english: But Lao She completely abandoned the miraculous denouement of Dickens"s novels in which virtue is rewarded and vice punished."
sentences.chinese: 狄更斯小說的結局總是好人得到好報壞人受到懲罰。

sentences.english: Dickens' novels have enriched English literature.
sentences.chinese: 狄更斯的小說豐富了英國文學。
狄更斯是位多產的小說家。

sentences.english: The coroner gives a look of encouragement to the juror and the accused girl wails.
sentences.chinese: 但驗屍官給了狄更斯和哭號的女犯一個鼓勵的眼神。

sentences.english: Dickens' "A Tale of Two Cities" is a literary classic.
sentences.chinese: 狄更斯的《雙城記》是一部古典文學作品。
我在讀狄更斯的《遠大前程》。

sentences.english: Which novel of Dickens’ are you referring to?
sentences.chinese: 你談的是狄更斯的哪部小說？

sentences.english: Read Ibsen and Dickens before bedtime.
sentences.chinese: 睡前讀讀易卜生和狄更斯。

sentences.english: Charles Dickens was a raconteur par excellence.
sentences.chinese: 查爾斯狄更斯是一個傑出的外匯善談者。

sentences.english: She was completely in thrall to Dickens.
sentences.chinese: 她完全是被狄更斯給迷住了。

sentences.english: Dickens'; A Tale of Two Cities is a literary classic.
sentences.chinese: 狄更斯的《雙城記》是一部文學名著。
或者有點像狄更斯筆下的世界？

sentences.english: This paper seeks to explore the academic value of the speeches made by Charles Dickens.
sentences.chinese: 本文從文學的角度探討了狄更斯演講集的學術價值。

sentences.english: Where can I find A Tale of Two Cities by Dickens?
sentences.chinese: 我在哪兒可以找到狄更斯的《雙城記》？
